topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Paige Costello, her background (Asana, Intercom, Intuit), and what the episode will cover, including trust-building, coaching, and Asana’s product process.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Brave Search API and Attio CRM.

topics.title: Paige’s scope at Asana and core product
topics.summary: Paige explains her org’s responsibility for Asana’s core desktop/web/mobile experience and the product goal of creating clarity around who’s doing what by when and why.

topics.title: How Asana’s planning and org structure evolved
topics.summary: They discuss changes in strategy-setting and planning: moving from annual planning to a rolling 12-month plan refreshed every 6 months, and introducing pillars/areas/teams with nested metrics and accountability.

topics.title: Double Diamond process and product reviews
topics.summary: Paige explains Asana’s Double Diamond approach (broad-to-narrow across customer, problem, solution) and maps it to artifacts like kickoff, direction selection, concept review, spec, experience review, and launch readiness.

topics.title: Asana hybrid work policy and office dynamics
topics.summary: Paige describes Asana’s office-centric hybrid schedule (Mon/Tue/Thu in office) and reflects on rebuilding in-office habits, serendipitous collaboration, and protecting deep-work time via chronotype awareness.

topics.title: Building trust and projecting confidence as a leader
topics.summary: Paige shares how to win over skeptics by bringing customer/market/product insight, asking great questions, and using a trust equation (credibility, reliability, authenticity over self-interest). She emphasizes customer exposure and confident presence in meetings.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Round, a private network for tech leaders.

topics.title: Coaching PMs through leading by example
topics.summary: They explore Paige’s coaching style—teaching via repetition and exposure (experience/exposure/education). Paige gives examples like running high-quality meetings and the advice to “answer the question they should have asked.”

topics.title: Career advice and conscious leadership mindset
topics.summary: Paige shares recurring advice: don’t self-select out, “think big, ship small,” and use conscious leadership tools like above/below the line and “how might the opposite be true?” to escape scarcity thinking.

topics.title: How Asana approaches AI and LLM product work
topics.summary: Paige explains Asana’s approach: an existing ML foundation plus a dedicated rapid-prototyping team that bypasses normal process to test hypotheses quickly, then hands off proven concepts to domain teams to scale.

topics.title: Intuit training lessons: customer focus and feedback
topics.summary: Paige reflects on Intuit’s APM and manager training, emphasizing deep customer-centricity and the SBI feedback model (situation-behavior-impact) as a practical way to deliver actionable, non-judgmental feedback.

topics.title: What holds back new PMs and how to succeed
topics.summary: Paige argues new PMs often over-index on being the expert, leading to advocacy over inquiry and performative collaboration. She encourages genuine curiosity, collaborative discovery, and focusing on outcomes over promotion-chasing.

topics.title: Early management missteps: avoiding micromanagement
topics.summary: Paige begins sharing lessons from mistakes transitioning to management, including learning to give guidance without micromanaging and using tactics (like writing thoughts on Post-its) to create space for others to lead.
